description: That kinda scares me right there. Why does it need these kinds of permissions?
summary: Edit, delete, and create posts in my Twitter profile?

description: This app works fine, if a bit clunky, for twitter. I think the default font size is a little on the small side, but that's adjustable.

Choqok is good! But it looks dated. The UI is confusing. It'd be great if the developers make it look nice & simple. It's hard to read stuff, and some buttons aren't working. Please, seriously this app needs a visual overhaul.

the "dated" UI reminds me a lot of yorufukurou on macOS! however, media posted on mastodon doesn't load for some reason and i can't seem to disable local and federated timelines, even though i unchecked them in the account options. i installed this initially for twitter but was surprised to find out it supported mastodon too which wasn't in the description! so oveerall it works, sort of, just not for my use case.

J’aime bien cette application pour le fait qu’on peut simple-cliquer sur un billet et le faire passer comme lu. Ça permet d’avoir un marqueur visuel et remontrer tout l’historique des frises Twitter. Bien sûr, il est multicompte, c’est vraiment pratique pour organiser sa veille. Malheureusement, le développement n’est pas des plus actifs, si bien de la longueur des messages n’a pas encore été corrigée avec le passage à 280 caractères et les tweets en citation. Bref, essayez et vous verrez si vous êtes Konquis, ou pas ;)
summary: Client Twitter multicompte KDE Plasma ou Windows (WSL)
